intro: Seseli scopulorum, commonly known as the rock seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its delicate appearance and preference for arid environments make it a notable species in alpine and subalpine ecosystems. Seseli scopulorum is often found in open grasslands and among scree slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
